alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sussex, Warren, east central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dingmans Ferry to near Delaware Water Gap to Belvidere. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Hackettstown, Blairstown, Hamburg, Belvidere, Oxford, Sussex, Hope, Branchville, Andover, High Point, Werry Lake, Greendell, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Hainesville and Great Meadows-Vienna. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
